intro: Artanthe phytolaccifolia, commonly known as the purple fringed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Artanthe phytolaccifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive flowers and foliage.
